metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22755 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
By using XSL Transforms, a malicious webserver could have served a user an XSL document that would continue to execute JavaScript (within the bounds of the same-origin policy) even after the tab was closed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 97.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
